caption: Amazing place. Service is amazing and everyone is so nice, And where do i start with the bacon Mac and cheese... its the best thing I have put in my mouth It is so mouth watering 10/10!!!
Food was great, seating inside or outside. Service was excellent. Live this place for lunch and a casual dinner out.
Good food and great service
Following covid-19 regulations. Fast, friendly service.
Great beer and excellent service.
Amazing selection of drafts and food, great service and lively atmosphere!!!!
Great place for a pint(fryers leap) and some food!!
The service was AMAZING! I came with my boyfriend and his family and they catered to his dairy allergy very well!
Perfect curbside pickup for food that's comforting, hardy and there's always something for everyone in the family. Smart, efficient and safe arrangement for take-out, and friendly staff.
Excellent every time 👏

We ordered online and got pickup, the fries were great! Burger was pretty good. But we ordered the peanut butter pie for dessert, and I was thinking for $11 it would be a mini full circle pie or at least a large sharable portion. It was hardly one piece of pie.
The server was extremely personable and didn't rush anything. I wasn't sure, but I truly believe she had a beautiful smile behind the mask
Good prices for beer and flights. The nachos with waffle fries instead of chips were amazing. Good service as well.
Good food and beer.  Liked that the menu had a real variety of choices beyond pub grub.
Good food and great beer.  Friendly helpful staff.
Decent food and better beer for sure. Not a bad place to start your night or have lunch at.
Nice spot. I love their Barleywine!

People were waiting outside so I went in to get a table for two outside and was told there would be a 45 minute wait yet the outside tables had only one in use. Yeah, we live in this COVID world yet they could manage their seating a little bit better.
Great food and beer. Service was quick and we were treated well twice by dining I and doing takeout. They also have beer to go.
Good food and good beer!

I ate here for my birthday dinner and it was great!  We started with honey sirracha chicken tender which were crispy and delicious.  The menu has so many options which I really liked.  I got a shrimp salad that had vegetables and peanut noodles.  So tasty!  The portion sizes are big so I have leftovers.  It is cool that you can try a flight of beers and pick the ones you want to try.  My cosmo was just ok, but I kind of expected that.  The food was awesome though!

Felt like a chain beer restaurant even though it’s not. Nothing unique to their brewery. Beer was ok. I really liked the mode de peche... it’s listed as a farmhouse but really is a sour. It tastes like a mix of the two.
Very friendly. Tried some beer but I'm not a beer fan. I still thought the beer was alright.
Place was clean, service was very good, nice wide variety of beer. I enjoyed the hazy IPA the most. The others in my flight were okay.
We were just passing through and stopped in Portland for lunch. We checked the reviews for local places and it was highly recommended. We were not disappointed.

Beer good, food okay. While I think I covered it in the first four words, let me elaborate. We had the orange chicken, warm soft Bavarian pretzel, and the chicken Caesar for dinner between the four of us. It was all fine, but nothing out of this world. Now, if you are coming for the beers, obviously you’ve come to the right place. All the beers I had were outstanding. I had a nitro stout, a red, and an IPA and they were all delightful. We made a reservation and had no problem sitting indoors. However, if we would have wanted outdoor seating, we would have been out of luck on short (less than 24 hour) notice.  Hats off to the servers because they were hospitable and experts at their craft.
We walked in to kill time before another reservation but we're pleasantly surprised by the amazing beer selection and food! The fish tacos and clam chowder are a must!
liked but removed one of my fav appetizers from the menu.dissapointed in that...
Rob made the tastiest dirty martini. Great restaurant and excellent services
All 5 beers I tried were good. The potato nachoes were excellent.

They had a good variety of craft beer on tap. Service was fast and the place was clean. However, the restaurant was not crowded. We had a flight. The beer was okay, not my favorite. I specifically was disappointed by their “black is beautiful” nitro brew as it did not taste like a nitro stout. Their peach ale tasted more like a sour. I like that they had indoor seating since it was so hot outside. Not a bad place to stop at for a drink.

Sebago Brewing Company is located on Franklin Street In Downtown Portland just under Hampton Inn first of all the vibe here is the best the wood and the colors really stand out the food is pretty good the wings are nice the service is good as well are server was very nice
Service was great!  my hamburger was not great!

popped in on a rainy day for some dumplings, soup and drinks and it hit the spot.... we traveled a bit up and checked into the Hampton above, so the appetite was roaring..... sat in a cozy booth, all was good!  ended up ordering dessert latenight as well... would def go again
Very extensive menu although the food really was not that good. Also the service never checks-in so difficult to get anything quickly

Unfortunately we did not have a good experience. They seated us at 6 and we didn’t even see the waiter until 6:30. Felt ignored the entire time. Drinks took 20 minutes. Had to go to the bar to ask for a water and even got trouble for that. Food was OK.. Asked for ketchup and waiter never brought it. Check took over 20 mins to process. Overall really bad experience with the service and just felt like we were waiting around. Would not ever recommend this place

Simply incredible food! We are gluten free and found many amazing options. We had the naked calamari, Peanut Butter, Bacon and Brie burger, and fish and chips. Both were incredible. The waitstaff was excellent. Can’t wait to come back when we are in town again!
I love a good burger and beer that's what I found at Sebagos Brewing CO.
Great beer and great staff. Mike was great. Very friendly. Fast service even though they were fairly busy.

I have been here many times and overall it is a nice place for food and drink. The house beers are a notable plus. However ... the service might be great or not so much depending on the server, and the quality of french fries is random (edit: all food will probably be very good but maybe not). The atmosphere is lacking. Compared to the previous location, it has all the charm of a bank lobby.
Awesome beer and the cod bites were very tasty!!!
Good food, good beer, great location!
Major points for being one of the only restaurants to serve food till 1am. Service was friendly and they had a 10 to close happy hour menu which was nice.
A very medium restaurant, but great bar and very family friendly.

(Translated by Google) The AC was set very cold. The beer prices are disproportionately expensive. We did not eat, so I can not say anything about food.  (Original) Die AC war sehr kalt eingestellt. Die Bierpreise  unverhältnismäßig teuer. Wir haben allerdings nichts gegessen, daher kann ich zu Speisen nichts sagen.
Big menu selection of fabulous food, great service, comfortable dining room
Claim Chowder and beer.  A great afternoon.  Good selection of craft beers.
Stopped in for dinner and it was great! The beers are good and the food is fresh and delicious. Great service at the bar and fun environment during Sunday night football.

Food and drinks took a very long time. Buffalo fingers were cold. Was able to get two drinks in an hour and a half. Stayed enough for apps but watching the staff bust their butt when clearly under staffed and manger finally coming out to help seem lazy and unmotivated. Seemed to be more in the way. Would not go back!
Fun place with great beers.
was not expecting perfection from those haddock tacos but thats what we got
First time visiting this location. Great place to grab some food and drinks and take a break while walking around Portland. The Haze FWD IPA on draft was delicious!  Will come again.

Love that wait staff. And the Vermont sandwich was good. Unfortunately the chicken in the Harvest Salad did not prove to be that good. The chicken's texture was unappealing and whatever spices on it definitely made it so we could not eat it. Our server was awesome when we told her. Would give them another chance but not order this salad.
Delicious beer!  The service was good and very attentive to customer needs and surroundings.
Bad food

My boyfriend and I each had a cup of the clam chowder and order crab cakes to split. The restaurant wasn’t busy and all the tables around us in the lounge came in after and received their food 10-15 minutes before we did. 2 crab cakes with greens and avocado on a plate should not take 45 minutes to get to the table. Chowder was good, beer was okay, service wasn’t anything to write home about.
Brew pub with almost perfect food and mediocre beer selections.
Very Good food, great beer.

This meal was way better than we expected. I got a lobster roll that was perfectly lightly mayo-ed with a healthy portion of fries. My fiancé got the shepherds pie which was also very good. We were happily surprised with the quality and taste. Would come back again!
Good atmosphere, good food, good beer!

After a long day, where else to go but Sebago for some great beers and good food. I've been here several times and the service is always outstanding. Food is on point and beer selection is awesomeness.
Good beer
I love their Harvest salad, can't go wrong with their burgers. Mac and cheese is also delicious. If you're there in the winter try the slick Nick beer
Delicious food and great service

Great beers, friendly service and tasty food. I went for the Simmer Down IPA which was fantastic. Definitely recommend visiting this place while in Portland. Started up by locals and they support the local community too. The food is reasonably priced, as are the drinks. Happy hours 4-7pm Monday to Friday and every day 10pm-close, offer discounts on food and some drinks. They also have a small selection of merch/gifts you can buy to support them and the variety is great. Really cool place all round.
Went on the recommendation of the hotel, great suggestion.
We go a lot because we work late.  The food is always the best and Rob the bartender is the nicest guy you ever want to meet. He makes the best drinks.
Good beer. Good food.
Nice atmosphere,  casual. Food was very tasty.
Sometimes can be understaffed a bit, otherwise it's a nice little place. Beer selection is pretty good.
Average pub food. Excellent wait staff tho.
Great burger, great service.

I've loved Sebago since the first time I had ever gone there. 110% honesty, I've never had one bad or negative experience Sebago in the ,at least, 50 times I've gone there in the past 15+ years. The food is amazing! Highly recommend my favorite, Bacon Mac n Cheese with lobster!! Sooooo good! The atmosphere is very relaxed, which is very important to me. And in my opinion, the absolute best micro brewery in Maine! Just wish they still had Boathouse Brown!!!👍 I frequent the Portland location the most.
Friendly service, good food. Most options are over 11 dollars but the food is elevated enough that it's worth it.
Love this place... pub food plus plus... pretty diverse menu. Service was attentive. 5 of us in the party and everyone was happy. Recommended.

Don't go here if you expect to hear what's on the 10 TV's surrounding the bar. How can a brewery/pub with so many TV's showing games not want to have the TV volume on? The staff said policy was to pipe music over the speaker system and not broadcast the TV sound. Had to go elsewhere to watch and hear the announcers for the games. Food and service was decent.
One and done.
The best! No matter the location the food is consistent and yummy. Highly suggest

My husband and I ate here on our recent trip to Portland after the other places we tried to eat were too busy. The food was VERY good but the service was only okay. We were only checked on once during our meal and had to flag down our waiter for more water and waited a long time for our bill. Great food, but expect to be there a while.
Not just beer and wine. Food was realy great.
Great food! Great beer/drinks! Excellent service! A must go!
Always been one of my favorite brew pubs.
Great food, beer and service!  Family friendly, will go back during our stay in Portland!
Beer was good, service not so much.
Highly recommend this brew pub. Family friendly with great food and beer. The haddock tacos and the bbq pulled pork sandwich were excellent along with their IPA. Would definitely recommend!
Food, service and beer were all very good!
If you like sweet drinks, get the Starburst cocktail, you won't be disappointed. It tastes exactly like a pink Starburst!
Kate was wonderful. Diligent and swift. I had the Fryes Leap IPA and Red Ale. Both very good.
Good food and drink, friendly and accommodating service.
Good service,  good food.
Great service and food with a fun menu. Looking forward to going again!
Nice atmosphere, quiet, local beer was good and the lobster roll was delicious!
Decent food and price. Except Korean beef, because it is not tranditional korean style. Like More German pickle dish
Open late, strong drinks. Recommened.

Lackluster service and decent beer. Staff was friendly and gave good recommendations for beer, they even let me try a few samples before deciding what I wanted. The food was good, better than average bar fare. It was clean and quiet for lunch but I do not think they expect a lunch crowd. They do some specials for evening/night time plus other events like trivia. In addition to their oven versed beers, they have a full liquor bar, wine, and canned macro brews. Sit at the bar, booths inside, or tables outside
Great selection and food. Fast service!
Awesome place to eat. Came to visit my parents and this is where they brought me.  Loved my meal and my drink very much.
Great pit stop for a locally brewed beer and an appetizer.
Great food.   Great service
Fantastic beer, great service, cool atmosphere. Go and see Jenna if you want exceptional service.

One of the best burgers ever, the waitress was very pleasant and very informative about the Sebago start location and how it got to where it is today! Great service and food! The beer was a plus also!!

Just went for drinks, so I can't attest to the food. We had fast service and our waitress stopped by several times to make sure we were doing okay. Split a flight of 8 beers with my husband, which were pretty good. We sat at the patio and there were other guests with friendly doggos, which is always a win for me!

We were staying at the hotel this is attached to. The first time we went for dessert and a drink was great. The waitress recommended the Tiramisu since they made it in house. It was amazing. Great service. We decided to get it again before we left Portland. We were seated on the patio both the first time and this time. We sat there 20 minutes and then left. Wait staff were coming and going frequently and not one even said Hi. Clearly inconsistent service.  I guess it is hit or miss if you will even get service or not.
Terrible service, terrible beer

The three of us were looking for a place to get a simple meal for dinner, something light and fairly quick but relaxing. I have the paddock, potatoes and asparagus yes, the other two parties had the French onion soup and Caesar salad combo. We were all pleased with the food. The service was excellent, attentive but not hovering, with pleasant conversation and a wonderful smile.
The beer is good, they also have happy hour 4-7 on weekdays and on Wednesday 22oz pours are only $3.50!  There is also a full menu and although I didn't try the food it looked pretty good.
The beer was great, the food was a bit pricy for what you get. Wasn't the best tasting food around. Rather bland and blah flavors in the large variety of food we tasted.
One of the best places to go in Portland for a quick bit to eat. The service and food are always 100% consistent, which is sometimes just what you are looking for.
Beer(ale options without too many hops) helpful staff. That’s all you need!

I've eaten at the Portland location at least once a week for the past 5 years. Food and service are always good (at the Portland location, anyway). Good menu - burgers and sanwiches, some seafood, soups and clam chowder. I've never had a bad meal. They have a full bar, too.  The prices are reasonable to slightly expensive - expect to spend $20 - $30 per person, without booze.
Beer is great and the naked calamari is amazing.  The sauce is perfectly seasoned and spicy

The bartenders are friendly and know their stuff..I was recommended the Blueberry Moonshine Mojito...it was AWESOME..I didn't have nothing to eat..however the menu looked YUMMY and the RESTARAUNT is super clean...
Good beers. Good service
(Translated by Google) Oo  (Original) Oo
(Translated by Google) Neo brewery restaurant, but good burger and mac'n chesse. Beer was delicious  (Original) Neo brauereigaststätte, aber guter  Burger and mac'n chesse. Bier war sehr lecker

The outdoor patio is dog friendly, but crowded for the amount of people there with dogs. Our puppy met at least 6 new doggie friends. The waiter brought waterfor him too. They have good local beer, but the bowls are hit or miss. My boyfriend got the vietnamese chicken bowl and it was rather plain. I got the Korean beef bowl and it was great. The patio is wheelchair accessible with an easy path inside to accessible bathrooms.
The beer was fresh, the wait staff fantastic, and the lobster rolls scrumptious!

This place has a really great open and clean atmosphere.  There were a lot of local business people visiting for lunch while I was there but it seems like a great gathering place for any type of crowd.  Lots of Sebago beers on tap.  The food selection was great and the server was very accomodating.  I will definitely visit again next time I am passing through Portland!
One star says it all. My husband and I will never enter your establishment again. And you might want to work on how you handle reservations.

Very pleasant experience yesterday, my sister and I went around 1pm sunday, sat outside, and our waiter liam was amazing. The best waiter I have had in a very long time, he was fast, kind, efficient, understanding, and happy, just honestly amazing. I am taking the time to write this because so often finding good service these days in stores or restaurants is hard to find. He was a++++, thanks so much!! The haddock sandwich and bloody Mary's were awesome too, and the outdoor patio is very nice with lots of sun! Thanks!!:)
great pub fare for great prices.  very nice selection of their own craft beer along with all the standards as well.  ALL  of the employees are top notch. great attitudes.

Thank you very much we had an amazing experience here and the food was amazing. We had great Service, If you want to be treated like a valued guest this is the spot for you. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a solid meal. You did not feel rushed you could enjoy your meal. The food was delicious, and the prices are reasonable as well. We will be returning soon

Super slow at everything. Taking our drink order, food, bill, etc... The group next to us actually dine and dashed which I never agree with, but we had to make exact change because our server never picked up the bill once we paid.

Staying at the Hampton and ended up at Sebago out of convenience. The beer was decent, the French onion soup was okay, but the fish and chips were awful, very bland and greasy. Coming from NY, we were hoping to get some delicious seafood...better luck next time.

A fairly simple menu with a variety of offerings. A bar all along one side of the establishment, many televisions for viewing current sporting events. Finding parking can be a little challenging for this location. The Ruben was delicious.
Service was great.  We ordered three dishes and they were 0 for 3.
Good selection of beer, ok taste, more of a restaurant than a brewery

My experience was very poor the bartender was a very rude young lady. I showed up later to meet friends so I attempted to place a drink order at the bar and her response after I had waited for her to acknowledge me was "you have a server" very bad customer service. For a first timer to that establishment I will not be back.

Nice ambiance, great beers and food that is a cut above the usual Pub fare. The salads are quite nice and the spicy haddock bites were exceptional. Combine all that with personable and efficient staff and you have a winner.
Super reliable food and reasonable prices. Good deals on weekly drink and food specials. The service is fast and cheerful
One of the best brewpubs in Maine.
Food is okay.  Beer only decent.  Employees were nice.
Good service good food and beer

Food was excellent and we liked the beers we tried. The service though... That was the real winner for us. I didn't catch the waitress's name but she was awesome. She even made me her own cocktail sauce recipe (the establishment doesn't normally carry it).  Great place to catch a game/drinks/food... The fish and chips were great. We also loved the shrimp & lobster ravioli.
Generous portions. Great food. The beer choice is excellent. Awesome service!!
Great food, excellent beer options, and great service. The parking is scarce, but if you don't mind walking a bit there's no problem.
Get the lobster ravioli. You'll thank me later.

This is our favorite brewpub in the Portland area. They have great beer and amazing food! Our favorites are the pub pretzels, reuben, lobster roll, and their peanut butter & bacon burger. They have the best fries too. Highly recommend!
Awesome Staff, and GREAT FOOD! Monday night trivia is always fun as well.
One of my favorites. Try the Fryes Leap IPA, so good!

We went for lunch, they offered some interesting things in addition to the regular pub menu. I got the bacon, Brie and peanut butter burger. I wasn't sure how I'd like it, but it was so good! Beer was good and the service was friendly.
Absolutely amazing! Allows dogs, so accommodating, great service and great food!!
Food was pretty good, as expected for a brewery menu. Service was good, nice patio for summer time.

I ordered the haddock fish and chips and was served what a believe was pollock. The consistency was wrong and it had a much stronger fish taste than haddock should. I can't confirm it was pollock but it most definitely was not haddock. I'm rather disappointed, service was great but I expected to receive what I ordered not something different.
The food comes out very quickly, but is very tasty. The potato nachos can be split amongst three people and you will still have leftovers!
Nice place. They have patio seating that is pet friendly. Staff was very polite and the service was quick! The spinach artichoke dip is to die for!
Can't give this place anything more than a 3 because they don't use Heinz ketchup.
It was alright. If you're visiting, go somewhere else

Told my wife I was going to write a nasssty review about this place because quite frankly we've been here for almost an hour now and have only received our one glass of wine. It all started when we first got here an the hostess didn't show up for about ten minutes. Granted yes we could of left but on a Sunday night during Fourth of July weekend it was the one of the few places open. 45 minutes from sitting down we finally received plates and napkins for our appetizers. I got very excited thinking the food was one it's way but 30 mins later and still nothing. I ordered another drink, the bonfire spirit because of the advertisement on our table. That took about 15 mins and it showed up in a glass the same size of a shot glass. I'm still here waiting for my food. I can definitely see why they are open until 1 am. P.S. This place is disrespectfully under staffed. The poor hostess was the bus boy, waiter, and every other position possible.
Awesome buffalo chicken salad

We attempted to order directly from the bar, but we were told we must order with the server. The server took 5-10 minutes to even greet us. We ordered a red ale. We received an IPA. We asked for water with no ice. We receive a cup full of ice.  At the end of all this, we told the bartender, and she quickly said sorry and returned to her work. It wasn't a pleasant experience. I wouldn't recommend it. The beer was decent, but not worth enduring bad service.
The beer is so much better on draught than canned in my experience. Very friendly staff.
Good food. Need more eclectic beers.
Decent place to grab some late night bites, beer and watch whatever sporting event catches your fancy.
went here on monday evening for their  great burger/ beer deal. everything was delish. our server was fantastic and trivia was an added bonus! i plan to go again soon!
Great beer, easy atmosphere, and the service was quick and nice!  This place is underrated!
Food and service was very good. Their beers were excellent.

Great beers, great burgers, my friends beer glass had a sharp edge, lanced his finger open, and the waitress did not care, just threw a bandaid at him. Not even a "sorry" service would say replace the beer he bled into, common decency would ask if he was ok...kind of sad, would expect more from anyone attempting to make it in Portland.
Decent burgers, good beer.
We sat at the bar and our server was very pleasant. We had the Hummus app and French onion soup. Good place to get a quick bite and drink.
Had a top notch steak here and classic New England chowder. The service was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere felt relaxed and enjoyable. Overall a nice place for a quality dinner.
Good range of beers.
Decent beer. Good food and entertainment on the weekends

Local brewery to Portland and New England. Brews a selection of about seven hoppy IPAs, which includes an annual seasonal limited edition. Brews are excellent. Restaurant has a cozy, fun, inviting atmosphere and the staff are friendly and informative to visitors & tourists. Not the "most famous" brewery in the area, but was recommended as a Locals favorite, and it lived up to the reputation. Highly Recommended!! (Attached to the Hampton Inn Downtown Portland -- Valet parking recommended.)

DO NOT ORDER THE FISH AND CHIPS! The fish was a large very flat thing.  There was more breading than there was tasteless fish. The breading was so hard that I needed to use a knife to cut it.  I would think that Sebago would be embarrassed to serve what was certainly manufactured and frozen fish when Portland is known for its fresh seafood.  Oh by the way, I did get indigestion from it.
(Translated by Google) Timmy Haines Chebacco lake  (Original) Timmy Haines Chebacco lake
Decent beer, expensive food.
Good beer, not the greatest selection but it is convenient that its one of the only local breweries that are open later.

I stay at the Hampton above Sebago frequently. The service and quality of food is always consistent. I love the potato nachos, veggie burger and seasonal dessert offerings. The seasonal beers are always fun to try and the staff is always able to make good recommendations. Even if a month or two goes by between visits, the staff always remember me and are warm and welcoming.

Awful service. We stopped in for drinks. Initially we sat at a table and after 20mins of waiting for a menu we decided to leave. On our way out there was two seats up at the bar so we decided to stay. The bartender was beyond rude and she clearly lacked the skills necessary to provide a mediocre service. We will never return. All not lost, we ate at Duckfat - amazing food and service!

Disgusting.  House beer was stale, menu was normal bar blah.  After two sips of one of their micro brews was ready to throw up ftom the sourness.  Need to clean your taps!  Paid our tab and walked out with glasses half full...  terrible Hampton... terrible!
The atmosphere and staff are outstanding. The haddock os a great choice.
Great beer and awesome specials
Always good food. Service is great too, even when busy in the summer months.
Great beer, really good happy hour after 10pm.
Great beer, modern facility
(Translated by Google) They produce their own beer Cool very cool !!!  (Original) Produzem a própria cerveja Legal muito bacana!!!
Wonderful Haddock and the presentation was marvelous.  The sandwich was stacked with the tomatoes all in the right place. Our dogs loved that they could join us in the festivities.
Food was pretty good and the drink deals were nice. The alcoholic fruit punch is essentially just juice, though, so avoid that.
Great happy hour food.   Evenings and late night.
A chain microbrew restaurant and feels just like so. Same old deep fried food and average beers.
Wow, such good craft beer and very cheap for what it is. It wasn't even happy hour!

This place has a great selection of gluten free items (including beer), and items that can be made gluten free. A decent beer selection and good food make for a great meal. The inside seating can be noisy though. Dogs are allowed at the outdoor seating.

Good food, excellent pricing and solid beer. This is a nice corner brew pub. We ordered the potato nachos, lobster roll and fried haddock. Both the lobster roll and the potato nachos were outstanding (5 stars). The fried haddock was okay. It came out over cooked and a dark brown shell hinting of old oil in the fryer. The beers were well balanced and they had a good variety. We'd enjoy going back here again.
Delicious!

Was just in Portland for a birthday and went out on the town.  This was the worst stop on that trip.  The location is fine, but it feels like you should check in before getting a table.  We were there at about 9pm, it was busy but not packed.  We were seated, but that was it.  10 minutes went by and no waiter.  I am patient, but there seemed to be a lot of staff.  Our order was going to contain food as well as drinks, but the lack of attention was disheartening so we ordered a beer and left.  I understand that taste is subjective, but I ordered a hazy IPA which was a clear red colored ale.  Maybe it is just that the other area spots had a lot more going on for them, but Sebago was just not doing it for us.
Rude service,  unfriendly,  purple sweats or whatever  she was wearing not the proper attire compared to what the other one worker I seen on a busy night!  (11-24-15) your welcome!!
Excellent food! Very nice ambiance. Good options for vegetarians.

This place is sort of disappointing in a city full of great restaurants. It's very reminiscent of a Midwestern diner. The food was mediocre. The beer is from the brewery, and while not bad, it's not great either. Apparently the happy hour deal is pretty amazing, so perhaps that's the a big draw.

Sebago is located in what feels like (probably because it is) the bottom of a hotel. the beer is awesome however, and even though the atmosphere is a bit clinical and hotel bar feeling, it has a little brew pub cred with the fermentation tanks. Service was nice but a little weird, and very quick. Dogs are allowed at the outside. The menu isn't huge but has a nice normal list and a few rotating seasonals which were very tasty. For a small brewery, Sebago has some great beer and sitting outside with one on a nice day is just perfect.
Great haddock new england fish dish. Garlic butter, mushrooms, onions, etc. Great place for Trivia on Monday as well.
Beer is OK. Just ordered Mozz sticks which were good. Service was quick. NOT a brewpub feel but nice people.
Great, simple beers.  Nothing very special but easy to drink in general.  Had a special batch blonde ale which was fine.  Actually a great strawberry salad with spinach!
Great late night menu. Also the biggest lobster roll you'll get in the Old Port, well worth it!
Yummm! Gluten free chicken tenders are delicious!

This review is for the Scarborough location. I am a beer snob. I can't speak for the other beers but the bourbon barrel stout was very good. Very faint hints of bourbon and oak from the barrel. I'd give it a 3.5 out of 4. I really liked the modern clean atmosphere and well thought out lighting, very inviting, The menu was full our good seafood and non-seafood choices at very good prices ($9-10 for burgers and $13 for fish and chips). 2 thumbs up!

Went to bar and was pleasantly surprised.  The beer was good.  Not knock your socks off but it was good.  Hopefully you go in the winter and can get their Slick Nick Winter Ale.  It was the best of the several I tried.  I did not get food.  Prices seemed standard for the area.  Also came off like a restaurant first, brewery second.
Typical brew pub with decent beer and good food. What made it was the service.
Had lobster here... fantastic. And yes very good local beer.
The brown lager was flat.
Beer = bleh

The food here was awesome, and I love that it's a microbrewery. The shrimp and pasta dish was really delicious, but could probably do without the bacon. The lobster club was amazing. We're going back again tonight!
